info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 03 at 6:52PM CDT until August 03 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CLAY AND EFFINGHAM COUNTIES... At 652 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Effingham to Farina, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Effingham, Teutopolis, Watson, Iola and Dieterich. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 between mile markers 142 and 164. Interstate 70 between mile markers 78 and 100. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
